X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) was employed to analyse chemical states and composition of elements present in the film surface, at a sampling depth of 2–10 nm
52 . In the XPS survey spectrum binding energies of 102.5, 284.8, 533.3, and 688.8 eV were observed, indicating the presence of Si, C, O, and F, respectively. Moreover, to further analyse the superhydrophobic film, high-resolution spectra of Si 2p, F 1s, C 1s and O 1s were obtained, as shown in Fig. 7a. The C 1s region of the XPS spectrum (Fig. 7b), showed that the carbon atoms were present in five chemical states. The peak at 284.6 eV corresponds to carbon linked to hydrogen C-H or carbon C-C; at 285.66 eV to carbon linked to one oxygen C-O; at 288.8 eV to one carbonyl oxygen C=O and at 291.8 and 293.8 eV to CF 2 and CF 3 bonds of the fluoroalkyl group
53 . Furthermore, Fig. 7c shows the F 1s spectra, where it is evident that the typical symmetric peak of organic fluorine was present at 688.9 eV. The elements that act as a marker for silica nanoparticles are the Si 2p and O 1s signals. The intense peaks due to silica nanoparticles, in the spectra of Si 2p and O 1s (Fig. 7d,e), were at 102.2 and 532.3 respectively
46 . Table 3 provides the atomic percentages for the content of the surface.
